perturbation.original_text: Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.changed_text: Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the express 90-day warranty on products could violate consumer protection laws in Texas (and South America, where the products are sold) if the product fails prematurely due to a manufacturing defect, leaving the distributor without recourse. This contradicts the implied warranty of merchantability as understood under Texas law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Business and Commerce Code, Chapter 2, Implied Warranty of Merchantability, Deceptive Trade Practices Act
perturbation.location: ARTICLE V WARRANTY, Section 5.01. Products Warranty

perturbation.original_text:
ARTICLE  V WARRANTY

5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above. Company further warrants all Products to be free from defects in material or workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of delivery. Any defects must be replaced by the Company within sixty (60) days within this scope of the warranty and all charges for labor and material, will be borne by Company. If it is determined that either no fault exists in Company, or the damage was caused by negligence of Distributor, its agents, employees or customers, Distributor agrees to pay all charges associated with each such replacement. THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.changed_text:
ARTICLE  V WARRANTY

5.01.  Products Warranty. Company warrants that Distributor shall acquire Products purchased hereunder free and clear of all liens and encumbrances except for Company's purchase money security interest defined in Section 1.03, above.  THIS CONSTITUTES THE SOLE WARRANTY MADE BY COMPANY EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED. THERE ARE NO OTHER WARRANTIES EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED WHICH EXTEND BEYOND THE FACE HEREOF, HEREIN, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL COMPANY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES AND DISTRIBUTOR'S REMEDIES SHALL BE LIMITED TO REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF NONCONFORMING UNITS OR PARTS.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the specific warranty period (90 days) and the details about replacement of defective products, the agreement creates ambiguity regarding the warranty's scope. This could violate consumer protection laws, particularly those requiring a reasonable warranty period. In this case, the products are being sold in South America, which may have laws related to the fitness of goods and warranties. Removing this info would contradict the intent of the implied warranty of fitness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Business and Commerce Code, Chapter 2, Implied Warranty of Fitness; Consumer Protection Laws in South American countries (e.g., Brazil's Consumer Protection Code).
perturbation.location: ARTICLE V WARRANTY, Section 5.01. Products Warranty

perturbation.original_text: 3.03.  Cancellation. Distributor may, at any time prior to the scheduled date of shipment, cancel any or all Products on order upon giving timely written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.03.  Cancellation. Distributor may cancel any or all Products on order. Any cancellation fees will be determined by the company.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying the clause to include cancellation fees without specifying a timeframe or reasonable cause introduces a legal risk. This deletion may violate consumer protection laws in Texas (or equivalent laws in South American countries within the territory), which require cancellation policies to be fair and transparent. An unqualified cancellation fee, especially if it's substantial and unpredictable, may be deemed unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Business and Commerce Code, Deceptive Trade Practices Act, unconscionable actions. Consumer Protection Laws in South American countries.
